setup.title: Inventors Matchup
setup.error: Drag the clip over one of the target boxes.
setup.complete: Congratulations! You have completed this XHTML Matchup exercise.

clip.successText: Garrett A. Morgan: Invented the traffic light.

clip.startText: Invented carbon filament for the light bulb.
clip.successText: Lewis H. Latimer: Invented carbon filament for the light bulb.
Sarah Boone: Invented the ironing board.
Albert B. Blackburn: Invented the railway signal.

clip.startText: Invented a lubricating process for locomotive engines.
clip.successText: Elijah McCoy: Invented a lubricating process for locomotive engines.
Patricia Bath: Invented the laserphaco probe.
Jan Ernst Matzeliger: Invented the shoe lasting marchine.
Charles B. Brooks: Invented the street sweeper.
Granville T. Woods: Invented the telephone transmitter.
Robert Flemmings, Jr.: Invented new, enhanced guitar strings.
George F. Grant: Invented the golf tee.

clip.title: Patricia Bath
clip.feedback: No, Patricia Bath was the first African American woman doctor to receive a patent for a medical invention.
Correct! Patricia Bath invented the laserphaco probe.

clip.title: Robert Flemmings,Jr.
clip.feedback: No, Robert Flemmings, Jr. invented something pertaining to a musical instrument.
Correct! Robert Flemmings, Jr. invented new, enhanced guitar strings.

clip.title: Charles B. Brooks
clip.feedback: No, Charles B. Brooks invented a device to save human labor.
Correct! Charles B. Brooks invented the street sweeper.

clip.title: Garrett A. Morgan
clip.feedback: No, Garrett A. Morgan invented a device to ensure human safety.
Correct. Garrett A. Morgan invented the traffic light.

clip.title: Albert B. Blackburn
clip.feedback: No, Albert B. Blackburn invented something to ensure the safety of trains.
Correct! Albert B. Blackburn invented the railway signal.

clip.title: George F. Grant
clip.feedback: No, George F. Grant invented an indispensable item used in a popular sport.
Correct! George F. Grant invented the golf tee.

clip.title: Lewis H. Latimer
clip.feedback: No, Lewis H. Latimer made outstanding contributions to the development of electric light.
Correct. Lewis H. Latimer invented carbon filament for the light bulb.

clip.title: Granville T. Woods
clip.feedback: No, Granville T. Woods invented a device used in telegraphony.
Correct! Granville T. Woods invented the telephone transmitter.

clip.title: Elijah McCoy
clip.feedback: No, Elijah McCoy was a pioneer in the automatic lubrication of engines.
Correct! Elijah McCoy invented a lubricating process for locomotive engines.

clip.title: Sarah Boone
clip.feedback: No, Sarah Boone invented a device found in just about every household.
Correct! Sarah Boone invented the ironing board.

clip.title: Jan Ernst Matzeliger
clip.feedback: No, Jan Ernst Matzeliger made a significant contribution to the shoe industry.
Correct! Jan Ernst Matzeliger invented the shoe lasting marchine.
